node.contents: I'm experiencing some issues with application freezes. It looks like it has something to do with the hardwarerenderer and perhaps the amount of threads I'm using. I'd love for someone to have a look at the logs and tell me if there's anything obvious pointing out. Thanks.

astNode.text: I'm experiencing some issues with application freezes. It looks like it has something to do with the hardwarerenderer and perhaps the amount of threads I'm using. I'd love for someone to have a look at the logs and tell me if there's anything obvious pointing out. Thanks.

node.contents: Thank you, I'll try to see what can be improved and if I can add handlers somewhere. I'm still not quite sure what caused this one though, as I am not overburdening onCreate(), etc., and I am doing all the hard work in separate threads and AsyncTasks.

astNode.text: Thank you, I'll try to see what can be improved and if I can add handlers somewhere. I'm still not quite sure what caused this one though, as I am not overburdening onCreate(), etc., and I am doing all the hard work in separate threads and AsyncTasks.

node.contents: ANR is well known issue. Make sure you do all the expensive operations in AsyncTask and do not overburden onCreate, onStart or onResume activities.

astNode.text: ANR is well known issue. Make sure you do all the expensive operations in AsyncTask and do not overburden onCreate, onStart or onResume activities.

node.contents: In particular, Activities should do as little as possible to set up in key life-cycle methods such as onCreate() and onResume(). Potentially long running operations such as network or database operations, or computationally expensive calculations such as resizing bitmaps should be done in a child thread (or in the case of databases operations, via an asynchronous request). However, this does not mean that your main thread should block while waiting for the child thread to complete — nor should you call Thread.wait() or Thread.sleep(). Instead of blocking while waiting for a child thread to complete, your main thread should provide a Handler for child threads to post back to upon completion. Designing your application in this way will allow your main thread to remain responsive to input and thus avoid ANR dialogs caused by the 5 second input event timeout. These same practices should be followed for any other threads that display UI, as they are also subject to the same timeouts.

astNode.text: In particular, Activities should do as little as possible to set up in key life-cycle methods such as onCreate() and onResume(). Potentially long running operations such as network or database operations, or computationally expensive calculations such as resizing bitmaps should be done in a child thread (or in the case of databases operations, via an asynchronous request). However, this does not mean that your main thread should block while waiting for the child thread to complete — nor should you call Thread.wait() or Thread.sleep(). Instead of blocking while waiting for a child thread to complete, your main thread should provide a Handler for child threads to post back to upon completion. Designing your application in this way will allow your main thread to remain responsive to input and thus avoid ANR dialogs caused by the 5 second input event timeout. These same practices should be followed for any other threads that display UI, as they are also subject to the same timeouts.

node.contents: I found a very specific cause for one of these ANR errors.

astNode.text: I found a very specific cause for one of these ANR errors.

node.contents: In one of my app's layout definitions I had set android:layout_alignRight="fieldX"

astNode.text: In one of my app's layout definitions I had set android:layout_alignRight="fieldX"

node.contents: But then in the definition of fieldX I had android:visibility="gone".

astNode.text: But then in the definition of fieldX I had android:visibility="gone".

node.contents: So the display was trying to align fields to a field that was not visible.

astNode.text: So the display was trying to align fields to a field that was not visible.

node.contents: By taking out the android:visibility line for the fieldX definition the app started to work correctly without hanging.

astNode.text: By taking out the android:visibility line for the fieldX definition the app started to work correctly without hanging.
